decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: A-EG-101-SL-001 Rev 00 Site Location Plan, A-EG-101-BP-002 Rev 03 Site Plan (Block Plan), A-EG-101-PL-100 Rev 00 Survey as Existing Ground & First Floor Plans, A-EG-101-PL-102 Rev 00 Survey as Existing Second & Roof Floor Plans, A-EG-101-EL-300 Rev 00 Survey as Existing Front, Rear & Side Elevations, A-EG-101-PL-110 Rev 03 Proposed Design Ground & First Floor Plans, A-EG-101-PL-112 Proposed Design Second & Roof Level Plans, A-EG-101-EL-310 Rev 01 Proposed Design Front, Rear & Side Elevations, A-EG-101-SP-003 Rev 03 Proposed Site Plan, A-EG-101-EL-320 Rev 03 Proposed Design Street Elevation & Landscape Plan, Design and Access Statement prepared by MGDC Ltd dated April 2021, Heritage Statement.
REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and HC1 of the Development Management DPD (2013), policies D3, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2016) and policies 1.1 (g), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Adopted Core Strategy (2012). | The proposed rooflights hereby approved shall be "conservation-grade", not project more than 150mm from the roof plane and retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

REASON: To minimise light spillage and interference with the privacy and outlook of adjoining occupiers and in the interests of good neighbourliness and in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B & 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Policies D6 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and the Hanger Hill (Haymills) Conservation Area Management Plan. | The window/s inserted in the side elevations and side dormer shall be obscure glazed and non-opening (where openable parts less than 1.7m above floor) unless otherwise confirmed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

REASON: To safeguard neighbouring amenity from light pollution in accordance with policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | No part of the flat roofs of the hereby approved development shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A ,7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policy D6 of the London Plan (2021). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment, revision or new Order) no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

REASON: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B & 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
description: Single storey (south) side extension connecting to the two storey rear / (north) side extension incorporating a garage with associated external alteration involving the insertion of a garage door opening (following demolition of existing rear addition, outbuildings and detached garage/spa); single storey front porch extension; side roof extension incorporating three rooflights; rear and side dormer roof extensions; alteration to front forecourt involving installation of soft hard landscaping and retention of existing vehicle crossover; alteration to front boundary wall to include a low brick wall and hedge.
